channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.description: Tesla's market cap fell below $1 trillion, but it still reflects investors' assumptions of enormous future growth.

item.title: ​​Inside the $99 million luxury wine scam that fooled over 100 global investors
item.description: James Wellesley and Stephen Burton established and ran Bordeaux Cellars, the company at the center of a sprawling federal prosecution.

item.title: Satya Nadella on the ‘enigma of success’ in the age of AI: A thriving business, but 15,000+ layoffs
item.description: Microsoft is spending $80 billion on AI initiatives in 2025, and CEO Satya Nadella says headcount is “relatively unchanged” even despite mass layoffs.
